monitors.customMessage: When you see this alert: 1) scale up from ACIS: Azure Resource Manager \ Service Management \ Update ARM Role Instance Count 2) Investigate what caused the high CPU, if it is worker, find out which job took the CPU (query JobHistory and group by call back)
monitors.description:
Huiqing: exclude Replicator and create another one for Replicator
Yushus: excluded RX tenants

monitors.customMessage: When you see this alert: {newline} 1) scale up from ACIS: Azure Resource Manager \ Service Management \ Update ARM Role Instance Count {newline} 2) Investigate what caused the high CPU, if it is worker, find out which job took the CPU (query JobHistory and group by call back)
monitors.description: 10/01/19 22:30 UTC (dabooher) - Excluding UK South 2 for ongoing issues connecting to storage accounts

conditions: USSec East,USSec West,USNat East,USNat West,UK North,UK South 2,Brazil Southeast

customLinks.query:
Errors
| where PreciseTimeStamp between (datetime({monitor.DataStartTime})..datetime({monitor.DataEndTime}))
| where Role == "{monitor.Dimension.__Role}" and SourceNamespace == "{monitor.Dimension.SourceNamespace}"
customLinks.title: Errors

customLinks.query:
TMMgmtTenantUpdatedEtwTable 
| where TIMESTAMP between (datetime({monitor.DataStartTime})..datetime({monitor.DataEndTime}))
| where TenantName == "<Insert Deployment from ARMProd Query>"
customLinks.title: Fabric Health

monitors.customMessage: This means we are not getting the MDM events from the instance and therefore can't monitor the service.  This could be caused by a few issues: 1. DR drill hasn't taken the region out 2. Issues with the instance.  Look at above Kusto Errors for that time/role/instance to see if there is an issue with starting the service. 3. Look at above Fabric Kusto query for this particular deployment to see if there are any issues with the cluster. 4. It could also be an issue with the MA agent not being able to connect - check MDM certificates, any failure in MDS config, or MDM outage.
monitors.description:
Vivek: Excluded BrazilSE and remove Norway regions from exclusion ist(6/07/2020)
Tian: Excluded UK North and UK South 2 since they are being decommissioned
Vivek: Excluded Norway West and Norway East and remove Germany and Switzerland regions from exclusion list (9/12/2019)
Vivek: excluded GermanyNorth and GermanyWestCentral role locations for New region buildout(7/22/2019)
Vivek: excluded SwitzerlandNorth and SwitzerlandWest role locations for New region buildout (07/14/2019)
Yushus: excluded RX tenants
Sanjaiga: Excluded old tenant (63fb0da927514a098106f44e3b185ff2) due to redeployment (delete) of SOSO cloud service in Japan West . We don't do this. Remove this later (after couple weeks). Incident 151968800  (10/09/2019)

monitors.customMessage: 10% more instances should be added automatically.
monitors.customTitle: [{Monitor.Dimension.__Role}] high CPU detected at [{Monitor.Dimension.RoleLocation}] (10% more instances should be added automatically if quota allows)
monitors.description: This is the alert for high CPU on admin role. This automatically tries to increase the number of instances by 10%.

monitors.customMessage: 2 more instances should be added automatically.

| where Role == "{monitor.Dimension.__Role}" and SourceNamespace == "{monitor.Dimension.SourceNamespace}"

TMMgmtTenantUpdatedEtwTable 
| where TIMESTAMP between (datetime({monitor.DataStartTime})..datetime({monitor.DataEndTime}))
| where TenantName == "<Insert Deployment from ARMProd Query>"
customLinks.title: Fabric Health

monitors.customMessage: This means we are not getting the MDM events from the instance and therefore can't monitor the service.  This could be caused by a few issues: 1. DR drill hasn't taken the region out 2. Issues with the instance.  Look at above Kusto Errors for that time/role/instance to see if there is an issue with starting the service. 3. Look at above Fabric Kusto query for this particular deployment to see if there are any issues with the cluster. 4. It could also be an issue with the MA agent not being able to connect - check MDM certificates, any failure in MDS config, or MDM outage.
monitors.description:
Vivek: Excluded BrazilSE and remove Norway regions from exclusion ist(6/07/2020)
heh: Exclude 9f1603eae8774e979fc94a8c719ad1c2 (West Europe multiVIP deployment)
antmarti: Exclude 355195b04fc549379340aad7e9a01fb5 (East US 2 multiVIP deployment)
shubai: Exclude tenant "4acf3de8b6c14f398792d14b4f246355" for East US multivip deployment
hamidt: Exclude 602c4b6e741049f8b0db55f823777258 for West US multivip
ezgambac: Exclude tenants e8ef4e974fe943daaa102a86691d6842,  8b81439d166f47e293bfa00ce56546d4 central us
Danwa: Exclude tenant 320f0422924149a08aa3e2b10c32e6a8, FDW south central US
Stivanov: Excluded Central India, as there is some testing going on there.
DRAMUY: Excluded the old tenant 80b9506b70184fa6abf8f8807ba26491 due to redeployment (delete) of FDW West US2
DRAMUY: Excluded the old tenant 9e289b5110684dcb934f19b87568087f due to redeployment (delete) of FDW for North Europe.
Danwa: Excluded old tenant (5dc3e4f097ef4a5ca94216d5225ae60d) due to redeployment (delete) of FDW cloud service in Japan West . We don't do this. Remove this later (after couple weeks). ARM Incident 152232341, Geneva Incident 152190652  (10/09/2019)
Ezgambac: Same as Danwa, excluded old tenant (394724d8589d48048785ade294b8ea76) from West Central Us due to redeployment (delete) of FDW cloud service. (10/11/2019)
Vivek: Excluded Norway West and Norway East and remove Germany and Switzerland regions from exclusion list (9/12/2019)
Yushus: excluded GermanyNorth and GermanyWestCentral role locations for New region buildout (07/22/2019)
Vivek: excluded SwitzerlandNorth and SwitzerlandWest role locations for New region buildout (07/14/2019)
Yushus: excluded RX tenants
2020-02-18 (tiano): Removing "UK North" and "UK South 2" from the list of regions for this monitor as they are being decommissioned.
